intro: Beware the cat in the shadows.

choice1.text: Is it someone I know?

choice2.text: Shadows don't scare me.

choice3.text: Can I stop them?

1: Perhaps. The closest paws often leave the deepest wounds.
2: Trust no one, y_c.
3: Only if you watch closely. Your wit will be your sharpest weapon.

intro: The sky shall spiral, roots will tear, what once was safe will fill with fear.

choice1.text: The Clan can survive anything!

choice2.text: Are you talking about a real storm?

choice3.text: What should I do?

1: Your bravery is noble... but even stone can be shattered by this wind.
2: More than wind and rain. Change is coming, and it doesn't ask permission.
3: When the winds rise, be the roots that hold your Clan together.

intro: Spirits scream in twisting skies; beware the one who tells sweet lies.

choice1.text: You mean there's a traitor?

choice2.text: This sounds like something out of a bad dream.

choice3.text: How do I know who to trust?

1: Figure out who you trust, before it's too late.
2: All storms feel like nightmares... until they tear your den apart.
3: Trust no one, y_c.

intro: A circle of fury will dance through the trees, and only the still heart will bring peace.

choice1.text: What does 'still heart' mean?

choice2.text: Sounds like someone needs to fight the storm!

choice3.text: Why me?

1: The eye of the storm -- that's where you need to go.
2: You cannot claw the sky. Wisdom must guide your paws.
3: The storm hasn't taken you yet.

intro: White thunder sleeps on the mountain's brow. When it wakes, it will not be merciful.

choice1.text: Thunder doesn't sleep... What are you really saying?

choice2.text: Is this about snow? Should we leave the mountain?

choice3.text: What do I need to do?

1: Call it what you will--snow, stone, thunder. It will fall, and many will fall with it if you're not ready.
2: Some dangers cannot be outrun. You must look for the signs... and know when to dig and when to run.
3: Guide your Clan with care.

intro: The mountain sings, soft and low. When its song becomes a roar, shelter will become grave.

choice1.text: A singing mountain? Are you being poetic?

choice2.text: So even shelter isn't safe?

choice3.text: Tell me how to stop it.

1: The mountain speaks--you must learn to listen before it screams.
2: Even your dens can become traps when the sky and earth fall together.
3: You cannot stop what has already begun. But you *can* lead others to where the snow won't reach.

intro: Buried hearts lie beneath frozen silence. Dig carefully, or you may awaken more than snow.

choice1.text: What's hidden in the snow?

choice2.text: Are you warning me not to dig?

choice3.text: Why are you speaking in riddles?

1: Secrets. Regret. The past does not rest easily beneath the cold.
2: Sometimes it's safer to leave what's buried... buried.
3: Because the truth is too heavy to give all at once. You must uncover it one pawstep at a time.

intro: The mirror lies. What flows clear hides sickness no eye can see.

choice1.text: You mean the water looks clean, but it's dangerous?

choice2.text: So... what should we drink?

choice3.text: I'll warn the others right away!

1: Yes. What seems pure may bring pain. Even water can lie.
2: Look to the places where the moonlight does not reach. There you may find what's safe.
3: Good. But they may not believe you--until the coughing begins.

intro: A silver thread has turned to poison. Those who drink deeply will fall first.

choice1.text: How can I stop it?

choice2.text: Who's behind this?

choice3.text: Will I get sick too?

1: Search for the source. Heal the water, and you may heal the Clan.
2: This was not done with claws. But someone knew and said nothing.
3: Not if you act quickly. But hesitation is as deadly as the water itself.

intro: They will drink, and they will suffer. Only those who thirst with care will endure.

choice1.text: You're saying I should be careful where I drink from?

choice2.text: Can we find clean water somewhere else?

choice3.text: Why is this happening to us?

1: Yes. One wrong sip can carry more danger than a fox in the den.
2: Yes--but you must search beyond where your paws have wandered before.
3: Sometimes, the land is wounded... and the Clan suffers with it.

intro: The forest's gifts have turned to curses. What fills the belly may drain the life.

choice1.text: You mean the prey is poisoned?

choice2.text: How do I know what's safe to eat?

choice3.text: I'll warn the Clan before it spreads.

1: Not poisoned... but sick. Their sickness becomes yours if you're not careful.
2: Trust your nose--and your instincts.
3: Wise. But not all will listen until the fevers come.

intro: The hunter becomes the hunted, not by claw, but by the rot inside the flesh.

choice1.text: Rot inside the flesh... is it spreading?

choice2.text: What caused this?

choice3.text: Can we still hunt at all?

1: Yes. One bite is all it takes. Then the illness walks on four paws.
2: A sickness older than your Clan. It stirs when balance breaks.
3: You must--but with care.

intro: Red eyes in the dark, limp legs beneath the trees... the prey no longer runs from death--it carries it.

choice1.text: That sounds terrifying... What should I do?

choice2.text: Prey with red eyes? Is this just symbolic?

choice3.text: How long do we have?

1: Choose wisely what you bring to your Clan. One careless bite could cost many lives.
2: Not symbolic. The signs are real, and they walk on trembling paws.
3: Not long. Act now, or the sickness will feast before your Clan does.

intro: Tempest comes. Tempest calls. Who are you to ignore the wind? Who are you to ignore the rain?

choice1.text: I won't ignore it. I'll lead the Clan through it.

choice2.text: What if I can't protect them?

choice3.text: Can we outrun the storm?

1: Then the wind may howl, but your spirit will not break.
2: Even the most experienced leaders falter.
3: You can't outrun the swiftest winds.

intro: Blind will you go, In the torrent of snow, In the darkness its seeds sow, Our light we will show, Should you let it be so

choice1.text: I'll find the light. I swear it.

choice2.text: Can we survive this snow?

choice3.text: That rhyme... is it a warning or a guide?

1: Then we will walk beside you--one pawstep at a time.
2: Only those who keep moving. Stillness is the cold's first victim.
3: Both. Remember my words, y_c.

intro: The warmth is not safe.

choice1.text: What do you mean?

choice2.text: Warmth is comfort. I don't believe you.

choice3.text: Can we stop it from spreading?

1: It will come when you least expect it.
2: [t_c shrugs.]
Listen, don't listen. I'm not here to coddle you.
3: Only if you act swiftly.

intro: Seeping and suffocating, rising and raising, our vital source will engulf our growth anew.

choice1.text: Are you saying the river will flood?

choice2.text: How can we prepare for this?

choice3.text: Water gives us life; it wouldn't betray us.

1: Yes, the river's hunger knows no bounds when the skies weep.
2: Seek higher ground and safeguard the vulnerable; the waters respect no boundaries.
3: Be careful, y_c.

intro: Bubbles will break the surface, rubble will flow and water will crush.

choice1.text: Is there a way to stop this?

choice2.text: Will the camp be affected?

choice3.text: We've survived floods before; we can do it again.

1: The waters cannot be tamed, only endured. Prepare your Clan.
2: No den will be spared if the river decides to reclaim its path.
3: Past resilience does not guarantee future survival. Stay vigilant.

intro: An unbreakable force will pull you down into the dark waters.

choice1.text: How can we avoid being pulled down?

choice2.text: Is this force the river?

choice3.text: We are strong swimmers; we'll be fine.

1: Stay together and seek the high places.
2: Yes, the river's embrace is cold and unyielding.
3: [t_c dips {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head.]
We believe in you and your Clan.

intro: There is frost in your blood that no warmth can melt.

choice1.text: Is this a sickness or the weather?

choice2.text: How can we protect ourselves?

choice3.text: We've faced leaf-bare before; we'll manage.

1: Think, y_c. We don't hold all the answers.
2: Share warmth, conserve energy, and guard the elders and kits closely.
3: This leaf-bare carries a deeper chill than any before.

intro: Nothing awaits but a cold embrace.

choice1.text: Is death coming for us?

choice2.text: Can we find shelter from this cold?

choice3.text: We must hunt more to keep our strength up.

1: Not if you prepare for it.
2: The forest offers little refuge when the frost comes.
3: Good plan. Good luck, y_c.

intro: Like weeds to a garden, a host has been found.

choice1.text: Is the Clan the garden or the host?

choice2.text: What is invading us?

choice3.text: We'll root out this threat, whatever it is.

1: Both. The invader thrives where it finds opportunity.
2: A sickness that preys on the weak.
3: Vigilance and care are your best tools against this monster.

intro: Beings of two will march the land, bringing destruction where they stand.

choice1.text: Are the Twolegs invading our territory?

choice2.text: How can we protect the Clan?

choice3.text: We've dealt with Twolegs before. This is no different.

1: Yes, and their presence ever growing.
2: Think of a plan before it's too late.
3: Complacency breeds downfall. They are not the same as before.

intro: Creatures, ignorant and vain, will settle in the land we claim.

choice1.text: Are they building something?

choice2.text: Can we drive them away?

choice3.text: Maybe they won't stay long.

1: Yes, their nests grow like weeds.
2: Their kind does not fear tooth or claw. You must survive, not fight.
3: Don't not let your optimism blind you to the truth.

intro: Fear the ones built like trees, for they shall do what they please.

choice1.text: What are they going to do?

choice2.text: We can hide in the dens. They'll never see us.

choice3.text: How much time do we have?

1: Tear through the trees, flatten the land, and leave nothing behind.
2: Twolegs do not need to see you to harm you.
3: Not long. I can hear the monsters already hum in the distance.

intro: Shadows walk into your camp, uninvited and unwanted.

choice1.text: Are you talking about Twolegs in our camp?

choice2.text: How can we stop them from finding us?

choice3.text: We'll move if we have to.

1: Yes. And once they enter, the damage is done.
2: Seek out the other Clans, y_c. Banding together may be your only hope.
3: A wise choice. Life is worth more than a single stretch of land.

intro: Like thorns, it's a grasp one cannot escape.

choice1.text: Are you saying we're trapped?

choice2.text: What will happen if we stay?

choice3.text: We'll cut through the thorns and make our way out.

1: Trapped if you do not act. The longer you wait, the tighter it holds.
2: Illness, hunger, and fear will follow.
3: Then move swiftly. The Clan's survival depends on your courage.
